result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dennis A. Trepania

records.addlTxt: DE appeared in custody with Atty Petros.  State appeared by Atty Marcoux.  State moved to dismiss and read-in 16 CF 25.  Court case is dismissed and to be used as a read-in with 16 CF 25.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 5, 2018 at 09:00 am.

Case called. Defendant Dennis A. Trepania in court, in custody by video.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DEF states Public Defender's Office has not appointed a new atty. State addresses court: DEF has right to move case forward with atty.
OFF RECORD discussion regarding inability of PD's Office to assign attorneys.
ON RECORD- Court requests DEF to get application for court appointed attorney. Court will make determination as to payment at a later date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 25, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Off the Record -  Defendant Dennis A. Trepania in court, in custody appears by video.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Reset, waiting for Public Defenders Office to assign attorney.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 19, 2017 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Dennis A. Trepania in court, in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE has fired his recently appointed attorney.  DE states he wishes to proceed and waive preliminary hearing, but court wishes for DE to speak to counsel.  Reset, DE told to contact public defender for re-assignment.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 12, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Dennis A. Trepania in court, in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  16 CF 25, 15 CM 35 and 16 CF 154.  Court addressed the Defendant.  DE wishes to have an attorney present for his prelim.  DE may complete State vs. Dean application.  Clerk to set with PD's Office.
Combined Bond 16CM35, 16CF25, and 16CF154

Defendant Dennis A. Trepania in court with attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt (special appearance).  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      CBS $5000  Combined Bond 16CM35, 16CF25, and 16CF154  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 19, 2017 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Dennis A. Trepania in court, in custody appeared by video.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Warrant quashed.  Court directed DEF to contact the Public Defender office.   Judge addressed Attny Martin Jarvis in courtroom regarding Public Defender appointment.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney McLaughlin called to advise that his file is no longer open for this defendant and he will not be appearing on behalf of the defendant at the return on warrant hearing today (06/05/17).  Mr. McLaughlin further advised,  defendant Trepania must now re-apply with the Public Defender's office if he wishes to have an attorney through that office.  mak

No abusive Contact with  - NIKKI MARTIN
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim " NIKKI MARTIN   " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.
